intro: Anthephora elegans var. villosa, commonly known as the silky anthephora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
